PLAY.TITLE: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra

PERSONAE.TITLE: Dramatis Personae
PERSONAE.PERSONA: SILIUS, an officer in Ventidius's army.
EUPHRONIUS, an ambassador from Antony to Caesar.
OCTAVIA, sister to Caesar and wife to Antony.
Officers, Soldiers, Messengers, and other Attendants.

PLAY.SCNDESCR: SCENE In several parts of the Roman empire.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Alexandria. A room in CLEOPATRA's palace.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PHILO
SPEECH.STAGEDIR:
Flourish. Enter ANTONY, CLEOPATRA, her Ladies,
the Train, with Eunuchs fanning her

SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Exeunt MARK ANTONY and CLEOPATRA with
their train

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. The same. Another room.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CHARMIAN, IRAS, ALEXAS, and a Soothsayer
Enter MARK ANTONY with a Messenger and Attendants

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. The same. Another room.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and ALEXAS

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, reading a letter, LEPIDUS,
and their Train

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and MARDIAN

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Messina. POMPEY's house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter POMPEY, MENECRATES, and MENAS, in
warlike manner

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. Rome. The house of LEPIDUS.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, MECAENAS, and AGRIPPA

Flourish. Exeunt OCTAVIUS CAESAR, MARK ANTONY,
and LEPIDUS

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. The same. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter MARK ANTONY, OCTAVIUS CAESAR, OCTAVIA between
them, and Attendants

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. The same. A street.
SCENE V. Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and ALEXAS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: She hales him up and down

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VI. Near Misenum.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Flourish. Enter POMPEY and MENAS at one door,
with drum and trumpet: at another, OCTAVIUS CAESAR,
MARK ANTONY, LEPIDUS, DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS, MECAENAS,
with Soldiers marching
Exeunt all but MENAS and ENOBARBUS

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VII. On board POMPEY's galley, off Misenum.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Music plays. Enter two or three Servants with
a banquet

A sennet sounded. Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, MARK
ANTONY, LEPIDUS, POMPEY, AGRIPPA, MECAENAS,
DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS, MENAS, with other captains
Pointing to the Attendant who carries off LEPIDUS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.STAGEDIR:
Music plays. DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS places them
hand in hand

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Exeunt all but DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS and MENAS

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. A plain in Syria.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter VENTIDIUS as it were in triumph, with SILIUS,
and other Romans, Officers, and Soldiers; the dead
body of PACORUS borne before him

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. Rome. An ante-chamber in OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter AGRIPPA at one door, DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
at another
Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, MARK ANTONY, LEPIDUS, and OCTAVIA

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and ALEXAS

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.
SCENE V. The same. Another room.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS and EROS, meeting

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VI. Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, AGRIPPA, and MECAENAS

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VII. Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Exeunt MARK ANTONY, QUEEN CLEOPATRA, and DOMITIUS
ENOBARBUS

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VIII. A plain near Actium.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, and TAURUS, with his army, marching

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IX. Another part of the plain.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter MARK ANTONY and DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE X. Another part of the plain.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
CANIDIUS marcheth with his land army one way over
the stage; and TAURUS, the lieutenant of OCTAVIUS
CAESAR, the other way. After their going in, is
heard the noise of a sea-fight

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE XI. Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter CLEOPATRA led by CHARMIAN and IRAS; EROS
following

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE XII. Egypt. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, DOLABELLA, THYREUS, with others
Enter EUPHRONIUS, ambassador from MARK ANTONY

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE XIII. Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CLEOPATRA, DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS, CHARMIAN, and IRAS
Enter MARK ANTONY with EUPHRONIUS, the Ambassador
Re-enter MARK ANTONY and DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Before Alexandria. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, AGRIPPA, and MECAENAS, with
his Army; OCTAVIUS CAESAR reading a letter

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter MARK ANTONY, CLEOPATRA, DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS,
CHARMIAN, IRAS, ALEXAS, with others

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. The same. Before the palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter two Soldiers to their guard
They place themselves in every corner of the stage
Music of the hautboys as under the stage

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. The same. A room in the palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter MARK ANTONY and CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, and
others attending
Exeunt MARK ANTONY, EROS, Captains, and Soldiers

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. Alexandria. MARK ANTONY's camp.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Trumpets sound. Enter MARK ANTONY and EROS; a
Soldier meeting them

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VI. Alexandria. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Flourish. Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, AGRIPPA, with
DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS, and others

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VII. Field of battle between the camps.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Alarum. Drums and trumpets. Enter AGRIPPA
and others
Alarums. Enter MARK ANTONY and SCARUS wounded

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VIII. Under the walls of Alexandria.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Alarum. Enter MARK ANTONY, in a march; SCARUS,
with others

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IX. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.
SCENE X. Between the two camps.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter MARK ANTONY and SCARUS, with their Army

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE XI. Another part of the same.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, and his Army

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE XII. Another part of the same.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Alarum afar off, as at a sea-fight

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE XIII. Alexandria. Cleopatra's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and MARDIAN

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE XIV. The same. Another room.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter four or five of the Guard of MARK ANTONY

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE XV. The same. A monument.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter CLEOPATRA and her maids aloft, with
CHARMIAN and IRAS
Enter, below, MARK ANTONY, borne by the Guard

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: They heave MARK ANTONY aloft to CLEOPATRA

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Exeunt; those above bearing off MARK ANTONY's body

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Alexandria. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, AGRIPPA, DOLABELLA, MECAENAS,
GALLUS, PROCULEIUS, and others, his council of war
Enter DERCETAS, with the sword of MARK ANTONY

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. Alexandria. A room in the monument.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter, to the gates of the monument, PROCULEIUS,
GALLUS and Soldiers

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GALLUS
SPEECH.STAGEDIR:
Here PROCULEIUS and two of the Guard ascend the
monument by a ladder placed against a window, and,
having descended, come behind CLEOPATRA. Some of
the Guard unbar and open the gates

SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Flourish, and shout within, 'Make way there:
Octavius Caesar!'

Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, GALLUS, PROCULEIUS,
MECAENAS, SELEUCUS, and others of his Train
Flourish. Exeunt OCTAVIUS CAESAR and his train
Re-enter Guardsman, with Clown bringing in a basket

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Kisses them. IRAS falls and dies

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: To an asp, which she applies to her breast

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Applying another asp to her arm

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Within 'A way there, a way for Caesar!'
Re-enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR and all his train marching
